info-builder.para: Elaborate and describe more comprehensively, for someone who does not write SCIRun modules

info-developer.para: Put module implementation details here, for module writers and SCIRun maintainers. If a drawing or two would help explain things, there is a place for them in the next tag (img).
info-developer.img: Put the relative path to one gif or jpeg here. Please put mages in the doc directory, and name them after the module you are documenting. For example: ./doc/ModuleXFig1.jpg

author.name: First name original author, successive names include major edits to the module for additions, changes. The last name on this list is assumed to be the current maintainer of the module

usage.para: If there is more than one port of the same type, disambiguate them by telling what they are used for in the module code
state the output's intended use downstream (if ambiguous or potentially unclear). If there is more than one output port of the same type, disambiguate them.

typin.name: Name a typical upstream Module (or "file" for Readers)

typout.name: Name a typical downstream Module (or "file" for Writers)

IO.example: A .sr file that shows the intended use in ./doc

also.ref: See Also ... classes, modules, datatypes, files within SCIRun, references, published papers, white papers, url's

platformIssues.issue: Platform issue. Ex. Needs 3d texture capabilities. Ex. works on linux only.

enhancements.para: list future work or possible extensions to the module

parameter.label: Identify it by the label it has onscreen

guidance.para: Spells out exactly how to modify the module's behavior from the gui example: "Using the left mouse button, slide the 'xxx' slider to the right to increase the number of bins in the color map."

gui-developer.use: Indicate how the code uses the parameter's value

gui.img: Take a screen snapshot of the GUI, convert it to a jpeg or gif, and put it in ./doc/ModuleXGUI.jpg. What goes in this tag is the relative path, ./doc/ModuleXGUI.jpg

procedure.para: Describe the special testing needs this module has.

steps.step: Put one step of the Test Plan here.
